summary: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.
synopsis: In this adaptation of the autobiography "The Pianist: The Extraordinary True Story of One Man's Survival in Warsaw, 1939-1945," Wladyslaw Szpilman, a Polish Jewish radio station pianist, sees Warsaw change gradually as World War II begins. Szpilman is forced into the Warsaw Ghetto, but is later separated from his family during Operation Reinhard. From this time until the concentration camp prisoners are released, Szpilman hides in various locations among the ruins of Warsaw.
trivia: Frank Finlay, who plays the father of the Jewish family, also portrayed Adolf Hitler in ITV Saturday Night Theatre: The Death of Adolf Hitler (1973).
